of course. Simon Cowell , Nigel Lythgoe had a lot to say about him as well as he talks about how the show was getting to dark with Simon Cowell 's constant nasty remarks to contestants. You forget that we've had this train wreck that was following Simon Cowell , and then Simon Cowell disassociated himself from the show over the last few years, turned his back on the strange people they brought in to judge. So I knew it was going to be better than people expected. He adds that the show has never been about Simon Cowell and he was the one person not worried when people told him to give up on Idol after Simon Cowell 's departure. Martin Luther King Day doesn't have much to do with civil rights, strictly speaking. It addresses the shooting of Rep. Gabrielle Giffords of Arizona and the rhetorical and budgetary attacks on public employees of recent months. ALBANY, NY( 01/14/2011)- The recent horrific events in Tuscon have saddened us all. However, from every tragedy lessons can be learned and the attention given by many to the contribution of violent rhetoric as cause for the shootings may be just the opening to bring civility back to our public discourse. I am further bolstered by the genuine joy expressed by U.S. Senator Kirsten Gillibrand in her account of the awakening of her friend and colleague Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords during a visit to the shooting victim's hospital room.
